alert.note: Alert for Camden; Gloucester; Northwestern Burlington; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 27 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of central New Jersey...and southern New Jersey... including the following areas...in central New Jersey...Western Monmouth. In southern New Jersey...Camden, Gloucester, and Northwestern Burlington. * WHEN...Until Midnight EDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Scattered showers and thunderstorms with locally heavy rain are expected across the watch area this afternoon and evening. Rainfall amounts of 1-2 inches with localized amounts near 3 inches will be possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

area.areaDesc: Camden; Gloucester; Northwestern Burlington; Western Monmouth
